name: @mblabs/centos-desktop
description: An automated CentOS Stream Desktop Packer project (currently, version 8) that builds boxes using the latest CentOS Stream release
author: Brian Zalewski <brian@megabyte.space> (https://megabyte.space)

scripts.prepare: bash start.sh && (test -f Taskfile.yml && task npm:prepare) || true

blueprint.description: An automated CentOS Stream Desktop Packer project (currently, version ISO_VERSION) that builds boxes using the latest CentOS Stream release
blueprint.name: CentOS Stream Desktop
blueprint.overview: This project houses configurations that can be used to build performant **[CentOS](https://www.centos.org/) Stream Desktop** images. It uses a CentOS Stream image as a base, uses Packer to automate the build process, and then sets the image up using some [Bento scripts](https://github.com/chef/bento/tree/main/packer_templates/centos/scripts) which take care of optimizing the image for your system (i.e. setting up SSH with the Vagrant default public key, setting up GuestAdditions for VirtualBox, etc.). This project is intended to be used to create desktop images that you would launch from your main desktop using a GUI. If you are looking for headless images, you should either use [Bento's server images](https://app.vagrantup.com/bento). You might also have some luck browsing through our [Packer projects](https://gitlab.com/megabyte-labs/packer).
blueprint.title: CentOS Stream Desktop Template for Packer
blueprint.version_description: Compact CentOS Stream Desktop ISO_VERSION image. Built from the CentOS Stream Server image using many of the scripts that Bento Chef uses. See https://github.com/megabyte-labs/packer-centos-desktop for more details.
